pros: I have gained great amount of experiences also learning hands on material such as trapping, data entry, and field work.

review_title: Good benefits but work culture needs improvement
job_title: Community Education Supervisor in Davis, CA
pros: Benefits are good. Training and advancement opportunities are good as well (depending on your position).
cons: Work culture needs improvement and varies depending on your department. Not many POC in leadership. Pay is not up to market for some positions.

job_title: Community Education Specialist I in Riverside, CA
pros: Great team of people Great flexibility
cons: No raise or opportunity to grow

job_title: Farm Advisor Assistant IV in Sacramento, CA
pros: Decent pay after a few years. Lots of freedom. Great network connections. Excellent resources via specialists within the university system. Great benefits. Flexible hours.
cons: Slow pay progression. Pay isn’t very competitive. Very little direct guidance. Lengthy annual review process. Not much room for growth outside of the biannual ladder slog. Management is kind of siloed away from everyone else. Not great in allowing remote work (obligatory office presence most of the time).

job_title: Program Education Specialist in Fresno, CA
pros: Great benefits, health, dental, vision, life, retirement and lots of extras. Money for professional development given out annually. lots of opportunity for trainings and development. Flexibility with time off. You can work with a lot of great people who care about the work they do.
cons: Can be hard to move up. Base pay is based on your years working for the UC, not experience. Raises are small and they can go a year or two without giving raises. Hard to let go of employees who do not work or management. The UC gives lots of second chances or turns a blind eye to bad management. HR doesn't help hourly staff....protects management instead.

review_title: Great place to work and learn
job_title: Applications Developer III in Davis, CA
pros:
great coworkers
learning environment
interesting projects
good benefits
cons:
low compensation
not much room for job promotion
lack of technology

job_title: Farm Advisor Associate III in Sacramento, CA
pros: Wide range of research opportunities. Typically a flexible work schedule. A reasonable degree of autonomy in day-to-day activities.
cons: Supervision and leadership can be fairly minimal. Most positions are wearing multiple hats due to lack of funding availability for more positions. Seasonal work load can become intense. Pay scale increase is slow (designed for career-long employment)
